column2: We are currently seeking a talented and experienced Female Front Office Executive to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing front desk activities, attending to clients, demonstrating our services, and efficiently coordinating various projects.     ?       Responsibilities :         Maintain Brand s social presence with the provided contents.         Greet and welcome clients and visitors with a warm and professional demeanor.         Handle incoming Messages, calls, emails, and inquiries promptly and courteously.         Provide excellent customer service by addressing clients needs and concerns effectively.         Conduct service demonstrations to potential clients, showcasing the quality and value of our offerings.         Assist in project management tasks, including scheduling appointments, coordinating logistics, and managing client communications.         Maintain a clean and organized reception area, ensuring a positive first impression for visitors.         Collaborate with other team members to ensure seamless execution of events and projects.         Manage administrative tasks such as filing, data entry, and maintaining office supplies inventory.         Uphold company policies and procedures while delivering exceptional service to clients and guests.         Continuously seek opportunities for improvement and contribute to the overall success of the company.         Requirements :         Proven experience as a Front Office Executive or similar role, preferably in the events industry.         Excellent communication skills in both Hindi and English, with the ability to articulate ideas clearly and persuasively.         Strong interpersonal skills and a friendly, approachable demeanor.         Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.         Proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook) and basic computer skills.         Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.         Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.         Minimum age requirement: 27 years or above.         Flexibility to work occasional evenings and weekends, as needed.         Bachelors degree or equivalent qualification preferred.

column2: Front Office Executive        (      Job Number:          HOT0ALC5    )          Work Locations      :          Hilton Bangalore Embassy Golflinks            Embassy Residences Bangalore        Pebble Beach,  Off intermediate Ring Road            Bangalore        560071                    With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories,  Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight.  From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience,  we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget.  In addition to our flagship brand,  Hilton Hotels & Resorts,  the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria,  LXR,  Conrad,  Canopy,  Curio Collection,  DoubleTree,  Hilton Garden Inn,  Hampton and many others.      If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world,  you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member.  Because it s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests,  Team Members,  and owners alike.          The Assistant Front Office Manager is concerned with the strategic management of the Front Office department following Hilton brand standards,  policies and procedures.  He / she is responsible for the operation of all front desk operations,  Transportation team,  Concierge and telephone service centre.            What will I be doing?      As the Assistant Front Office Manager,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:       Maintain a high customer service focus by approaching your job with the customers always in mind.        Have a positive impact,  taking personal responsibility and initiative to resolve issues,  always clearly communicating with both customers and colleagues.        Be motivated and committed,  approaching all tasks with enthusiasm and seizing opportunities to learn new skills or knowledge in order to improve your personal performance.        Flexible,  respond quickly and positively to changing requirements including the performance of any tasks requested of you.        Maintain high team focus by showing cooperation and support to colleagues in the pursuit of team goals.        Contribute ideas and suggestions to enhance operational / environmental procedures in the hotel.        Actively promote the services and facilities of Hilton hotels to guests and suppliers of the hotel.        Actively seeking verbal feedback from customers and team members at every opportunity.        Agree on and implement actions to make improvements to customer service.        Positively deal with and learn from customer complaints and comments with follow-up and feedback to the Front Office Manager.        Make sure all customer requests and queries are responded to promptly and effectively while assisting on the floor during peak periods each day.        Be available to assist on duty in the hotels during any busy days or special events.        Maintain a presence in the lobby,  setting the example to team members for guest service.        Be proactive towards guests,  assisting them with any reasonable requests,  and training all team members to see these things before guests ask.        Knowledgeable of Hilton departmental standards.        Able to explain the standards to the team and train each team member individually with specific job skills checklists that relate to their responsibilities.        Assess team members  performance against standards.        Monitor standards through regular standards review checks.        Develop action plans to address shortfalls in standards and identify shortfalls before they affect customer service.        Implement and follow through with improvements identified.        Demonstrate positive leadership characteristics which inspire team members to meet and exceed standards.        Prepare rosters and job schedules for team members to meet business needs (taking into consideration internal activities,  occupancy,  external events,  promotions,  etc. )       Communicate effectively with Housekeeping,  groups and tours on in-house groups holding catering events,  ensuring direct liaison with group leaders upon arrival for special requests.        Describe,  assign and delegate duties and authority for the operation of the department at all times.        Understand the situation in other departments and its implication for your own department.        Planning ahead and ensuring adequate resources are available.        Coordinate with the Housekeeping department to ensure that cleaning is followed up with and procedures are maintained.        Ensure the shift is reviewed,  handovers and briefings are carried out.        Maintain in-depth technical knowledge and skills required for the job.        Maintain guest histories to assist with returning guests.        Establish good communication with the Housekeeping team.        Attend and participate in regular operational and hotel meetings.        Ensure that supplier liaison together with the Purchasing team ensures maximum support with regards to sponsorship,  marketing and pricing initiatives.        Be responsible for the maximization of room revenue and profit through commercial rooms management,  ensuring a consistently high standard of customer service within the department.        Make all decisions regarding overbooking the hotel on the same day,  ensure all out bookings are carried out by members of the Management and that overbooking levels for future days will be monitored by the Revenue Manager.        Understand the goals of the hotel and the department s role in achieving it,  communicating goals to the team.        Ensure that the daily operation is managed by the Guest Service Managers and Supervisors who are totally accountable for the profitability and service standards achieved.        Set and agree to departmental objectives for self and team.        Represent the needs of the team to others in the hotel.        Get members of the team to work cooperatively with others.        Keep the team up to date on departmental,  hotel and company activities through regular communication meetings and memos,  including special events and promotions in the restaurants and bars.        Be aware of potential highs and lows in the business.        Create and implement sales promotions and team member incentives as per discussion with the Front Office Manager.        Assist the Marketing and Communications team with the preparation of the events brochure.        Assist with the annual marketing plan to establish a list of marketing activities in line with the annual business plan,  supported by appropriate advertising and promotion budgets from suppliers and the Revenue Manager and the Marketing and Communications team.        Identify,  communicate and act on potential sales leads.        Participate in the development of the annual budget,  developing short and long term financial operating plans.        Use key monitors and financial targets to evaluate the department s performance and make future plans.        Analyze financial information that is provided via the payroll system and ONQ,  to assist decision making.        Complete regular financial and operating reports,  as required or requested by the Front Office Manager and forecast potential costs.        Review expenses on a monthly basis to implement actions for improvement,  following company control procedures.        Control costs without compromising standards.        Communicate relevant financial information to the team.        Analyze and explain any financial variance against plan.        Set-up and maintain leave plans,  monitor,  control and minimize overtime for the department.        Carry out seasonal inventory of operating equipment.        Understand the quantity and quality of people needed for the department to operate.        Carry out selection interviews and make effective recruitment decisions based on skills and attitude.        Ensure the new recruits have all relevant information before commencing employment.        Plan and ensure departmental orientation,  trainings and assessments to maintain standards are carried out.        Regularly review individual and team performance against objectives and provide feedback.        Develop and implement department training plans to meet business needs.        Carry out training programs for team members with the Training Manager and departmental trainers.        Assist in the training of team members ensuring that they have the necessary skills to perform their duties with the maximum efficiency.        Review and evaluate all training activities.        Carry out annual appraisals with all team members and identify individual training needs,  in accordance with legal and hotel guidelines.        Introduce appropriate product knowledge courses for team members.        Communicate to the team their responsibilities within Health & Safety (H&S).        Provide relevant training to the new join team member.        Understand the relevant H&S legislations and their implication on the operation of the department.        Ensure that safe and healthy working practices are implemented at all times.        Participate in community public relations for the hotel.                        What are we looking for?      An Assistant Front Office Manager serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviour,  skills,  and values that follow:       Good communication,  organization and coordination skills.        Good team spirit.        Strong sense of responsibility and self-motivation.        Patient,  responsible and proactive in dealing with problems.        Able to maintain excellent relations with team members.        Able to work under great physical and mental pressures.        Familiar with computer systems.        Fluent in spoken and written English to meet busines needs.            What will it be like to work for Hilton?       Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.  And,  our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!                     Job      :        Guest Services,  Operations,  and Front Office          Schedule      :        Full-time

From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience,  we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget.  In addition to our flagship brand,  Hilton Hotels & Resorts,  the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria,  LXR,  Conrad,  Canopy,  Curio Collection,  DoubleTree,  Hilton Garden Inn,  Hampton and many others.      If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world,  you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member.  Because it s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests,  Team Members,  and owners alike.          The Front Office Executive is concerned with the strategic management of the Front Office department following Hilton brand standards,  policies and procedures.  He / she is responsible for the operation of all front desk operations,  Transportation team,  Concierge and telephone service centre.            What will I be doing?          As Front Office Executive,  you will supervise Reception operations and set departmental goals and targets to ensure a continuously improving customer service experience to Guests.  The Front Office Executive interacts with Guests and contributes to the first impressions of our Guests and,  therefore,  must perform the following tasks to the highest standards:      Supervise accurate and efficient Reception operations including check in/out procedures    Support Team Members in handling Guest requests and enquires to ensure a positive outcome    Ensure the Front Office Manager is fully aware of any relevant feedback from Guests and/or other departments    Ensure a consistent,  high level of customer service    Brief your team on any events or VIP guests in the hotel that day    Drive sales revenues and promote hotel services and facilities for up-selling opportunities    Understand and apply correct procedures regarding the acceptance of foreign currencies,  credit cards and cash in accordance with the hotel credit policy    Assist with the implementation and achievement of departmental targets and objectives,  work schedules,  budgets and policies and procedures    Monitor the appearance,  standards and performance of the Front Office Team with an emphasis on training and teamwork    Ensure Team Members have current knowledge of all room categories,  room rates,  packages,  promotions,  local area and other general product knowledge necessary to perform their duties    Demonstrate positive leadership characteristics to inspire Team Members to meet and exceed standards    Act in accordance with the front of house equipment and the property management systems    Conduct training programs on an ongoing basis    Carry out shift handovers and brief team members as required    Follow company brand standards    Assist other departments,  as necessary,  and maintain good working relationships with hotel Team Members                        What are we looking for?      A Front Office Executive serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviour,  skills,  and values that follow:       Experience supervising people and leading teams    Previous experience in a customer-focused industry    Positive attitude and good communication skills    Committed to delivering a high level of customer service    Excellent grooming standards    Ability to work on your own or as part of a team    Competent level of IT proficiency      It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:      Previous experience in a hotel environment            What will it be like to work for Hilton? column2: Are you an organized and personable individual with a passion for fitness and wellness? Do you thrive in a fast-paced and customer-centric environment? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!    Cult.Fit is a leading fitness and wellness company that is dedicated to helping individuals achieve their health and fitness goals. We are currently seeking a Front Office Executive to join our dynamic team and play a key role in delivering a superior customer experience.    Job Title: Front Office Executive    Location: Cult.Fit, [Location]    Job Summary:  As a Front Office Executive, you will be the first point of contact for our members and guests, representing the face of our brand. You will be responsible for managing all front desk activities, including welcoming visitors, answering phone calls and inquiries, and providing exceptional customer service to ensure a positive experience for everyone who walks through our doors.    Key Responsibilities:  - Greet and assist all members and guests in a friendly and professional manner  - Handle all incoming calls and emails, providing accurate and timely information or directing inquiries to the appropriate team member  - Maintain a clean and organized front desk and lobby area  - Manage member check-ins, appointments, and class registrations  - Process payments and handle cash transactions  - Assist with membership sales and promotions  - Collaborate with the operations team to ensure a seamless and efficient experience for members  - Act as a brand ambassador by promoting Cult.Fit's services and offerings  - Provide support to the team as needed and perform other duties as assigned    Qualifications and Skills:  - High school diploma or equivalent  - 1-2 years of customer service or front desk experience, preferably in the health and fitness industry  - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  - Strong organizational and multitasking abilities  - Proficient in using computer software and systems  - Enthusiastic and outgoing personality with a genuine passion for health and wellness  - Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends    Why Join Cult.Fit:  At Cult.Fit, we are committed to creating a positive and inspiring work environment where personal growth and development are encouraged. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to interact with a diverse and dynamic community, and make a meaningful impact on the lives of our members. In addition to competitive compensation and benefits, you will also have access to our fitness and wellness programs, and the opportunity for career advancement within the company.    If you are ready to bring your energy and enthusiasm to a company that is dedicated to helping others achieve their fitness goals, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team as a Front Office Executive and be a part of the Cult.Fit experience! column1: School Admission counsellor, Front desk executive,
column2: We are seeking a dynamic and customer-oriented individual to join team as a School Admission Counselor and Front Desk Executive at a CBSE affiliated school in Hyderabad, Telangana.      This dual role requires someone who can effectively handle admissions inquiries while also managing front desk operations with professionalism and efficiency.                Responsibilities:              1. Admission Counseling:        - Assist prospective parents and students with inquiries regarding admissions procedures, requirements, and programs offered.        - Provide detailed information about the schools curriculum, facilities, extracurricular activities, and admission deadlines.        - Conduct campus tours for prospective families and address any questions or concerns they may have.              2. Application Processing:        - Receive and process admission applications accurately and in a timely manner.        - Verify and organize application documents, including transcripts, recommendation letters, and other required materials.        - Follow up with applicants to ensure all necessary documents are submitted and application fees are paid.              3. Front Desk Operations:        - Serve as the first point of contact for visitors, parents, and students entering the school premises.        - Answer incoming calls, respond to inquiries, and direct calls to the appropriate staff members.        - Manage the schools reception area, including greeting visitors, signing them in, and providing assistance as needed.        - Handle incoming and outgoing mail, courier packages, and deliveries.              4. Join our team and play a vital role in welcoming new students and families to our school community. Apply now to become a part of our dynamic team! column2: As a Front Office Executive at Bhoomi Hospitals, you will serve as the first point of contact for patients and visitors, providing exceptional customer service and administrative support. Your primary responsibilities will include: Patient Reception and Registration: Greet patients and visitors in a friendly and welcoming manner. Register new patients, collect demographic and insurance information, and verify existing patient details. Schedule appointments, surgeries, and follow-up visits according to established procedures. Appointment Management: Manage the appointment scheduling system, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and optimal patient flow. Coordinate with medical staff and departments to schedule patient appointments based on availability and urgency. Remind patients of upcoming appointments via phone calls, messages, or email. Patient Check-In and Check-Out: Facilitate the check-in process by verifying patient information, collecting co-payments or fees, and issuing visitor passes as needed. Assist patients with completing necessary forms and paperwork. Ensure smooth check-out process by providing patients with discharge instructions, arranging follow-up appointments, and processing payments. Telephone and Email Correspondence: Handle incoming calls and inquiries, providing information about hospital services, appointments, and general inquiries. Respond to email inquiries promptly and professionally, directing messages to the appropriate department or staff member. Patient Assistance and Support: Address patient concerns, complaints, or special requests with empathy and professionalism. Provide assistance to patients with mobility challenges, directing them to designated areas or arranging for wheelchair assistance. Liaise with nursing staff and other departments to address patient needs and requests promptly. Administrative Tasks: Maintain electronic and paper-based patient records, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality. Perform data entry tasks, update patient information, and generate reports as required. Assist with billing inquiries, insurance claims processing, and coordination with finance department. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or related field preferred. Proven experience as a Front Office Executive or similar role in a healthcare setting is advantageous. Strong customer service orientation and excellent interpersonal skills. Proficiency in computer applications, including MS Office suite and electronic medical record (EMR) systems. Ability to multitask, prioritize responsibilities, and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Empathy, patience, and a compassionate approach to patient care.

column2: Job Description       Receptionists perform basic gate keeping and administration duties, often while sitting in the primary entryway of an office or facility. Typical job duties include:      Answering the phone: While many companies have voicemail systems, some callers still prefer to connect with a human being. In some cases, a caller may not know who they should be speaking to within an organization, particularly if their contact is no longer with the business. A receptionist serves as a point person for directing these calls.      Appointment setting: The FOE may schedule and set appointments for executives and high-level managers.      Greeting visitors: FOE greet visitors and notify employees that guests have arrived.      Accepting deliveries: A FOE may be tasked with accepting deliveries, including packages, certified and registered mail and communications sent by courier.      Administrative tasks: Some FOE s are responsible for administrative tasks, including maintaining files and spreadsheets or sending out interoffice communications.

column2: Damodar Ropeways & Infra Limited Profile  Front Office and Admin. Job Location - Kolkata Responsibilities 1. Handle the front desk and create a welcoming, professional environment for the visitors. 2. Researching travel options, comparing costs, obtaining approval, and advising on the most economical travel arrangements. Handling train and flight ticket bookings, including identifying new agents for better prices, negotiating, and documenting broker details. 3. Reconciling ticket expenses with credit card statements and performing Bank Reconciliation Statements (BRS) for accuracy. 4. Providing alternative solutions during peak times and arranging bus tickets when necessary. 5. Reviewing and processing bills in accordance with approved documentation and emails. 6. Managing administrative tasks such as light maintenance, coordinating repairs for doors, AC units, and toilets, maintaining stock levels of office supplies, ordering items from vendors, overseeing office property, supervising service calls, and ensuring their closure. 7. Procuring local supplies including toiletries, cleaning products, cartridges, and kitchenware. 8. Overseeing housekeeping duties, maintaining stock levels, verifying bills and attendance records, and processing payments in compliance with regulations. 9. Monitoring cleanliness in the cafeteria, boardroom, and front desk areas. 10. Managing telephone and broadband services, submitting bills, handling new connections with necessary paperwork, terminating services as needed and maintaining dongles. 11. Tracking uniform and shoe inventory across sites, managing stock levels, and coordinating with couriers and tailors as necessary. 12. Handling documentation and filing tasks related to job responsibilities and management information systems (MIS). 13. Compiling monthly attendance data, calculating work hours, and submitting reports. 14. Ordering and receiving stationery for official use, and maintaining stock levels. 15. Creating ID cards for site employees. 16. Ordering payment vouchers, spring files, letterheads, etc., for printing purposes. 17. Updating the Matrix Software daily with information regarding overtime, holidays, weekly offs, and employee statuses. 18. Verifying third-party billing calculations for site security (e.g., PF, ESI) against agreements. 19. Maintaining files related to overtime, security, speed post, and courier bills. *Please note that you will be provided assistance. Requirements Associate or bachelors degree in a related field. Professional appearance, courteous manner, and clear, friendly. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Competency in Microsoft applications including Word and Excel. Good time management skills. Proactive, organized approach to multitasking. Experience with administrative and clerical procedures. Able to contribute positively as part of a team, helping with various tasks as required.

column2: We are searching for a self-motivated and organized individual to join our team as a Front Desk & HR Executive. This role offers a unique opportunity to wear multiple hats and contribute significantly to the smooth functioning of our organization. You will be responsible for a variety of tasks, including managing the front desk, coordinating travel arrangements, overseeing housekeeping, handling administrative duties, and providing general HR support. Responsibilities: Front Desk:   Greet visitors and guests in a professional and courteous manner. Manage the reception area, ensuring its cleanliness and organization. Answer phones, direct calls, and take messages accurately. Manage visitor logs and maintain confidentiality. column2: Acme Visa Solutions is the biggest immigration consulting firm in western Canada; we provide fast, professional and reasonably-priced immigration services to clients around the world. Over one decade's establishment, we have assisted over 15,000 applicants to receive visas to come to Canada as permanent residents. Our scope of service includes Skills Immigration, Business Immigration, Family Class, Study Permits and a variety of Work Permit applications; more importantly, our expertise in BC Provincial Nominees Program and Express Entry are industry-leading. Acme Visa Solutions is international with head office located in Canada (Metro Vancouver, BC) and other branches located across the globe in India (Jalandhar, Ludhiana, and New Delhi), UAE (Dubai), London (UK), Abbotsford & Toronto and we continuously intend to grow. Position Overview: A Front Office Executive plays a vital role in the smooth functioning of an organization. This position requires excellent communication and interpersonal skills, as the Front Office Executive is the first point of contact for visitors, clients, and employees. The primary responsibility is to ensure efficient and professional reception and administrative support to maintain a positive image of the organization. Key Responsibilities: Reception Duties: Greet and welcome visitors and direct them appropriately. Answer phone calls, screen and forward them to the relevant person or department. Provide accurate information and address inquiries or requests from clients, employees, and the public. Maintain a tidy and presentable reception area. Administrative Support: Schedule and manage appointments, meetings, and conference room bookings. Assist with travel arrangements, including flight bookings, hotel reservations, and transportation. Maintain office supplies inventory and place orders when necessary. Handle incoming and outgoing mail, packages, and deliveries. Assist in the coordination of office events and functions. Assist in basic accounting tasks, such as invoice preparation and expense tracking. Perform data entry, documentation, and filing tasks as needed. Communication and Coordination: Liaise with internal departments, employees, and external stakeholders as required. Maintain a professional and friendly demeanor when interacting with clients and visitors. Collaborate with other team members to ensure efficient office operations. Relay messages and important information to the appropriate personnel promptly. Technology and Equipment Management: Operate and manage office equipment, such as telephone systems, printers, and photocopiers. Troubleshoot basic technical issues and escalate to IT support if necessary. Keep track of inventory for office supplies and request replenishment as needed. Assist employees with basic software applications and troubleshoot common user issues. Qualifications and Skills: High school diploma or equivalent (some organizations may require a bachelor's degree). Proven work experience as a Front Office Executive or similar role is preferred. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. Proficient in using computer applications (MS Office, email, calendar management). Professional appearance and a courteous approach. Ability to handle stressful situations with patience and composure. Attention to detail and problem-solving skills. Flexibility to work in shifts and adapt to changing schedules. Familiarity with administrative and clerical procedures is an advantage. Interested ones can send their cv on navya@acmevisa.com or 9875967983

Job Title:  Front Desk Executive Job Description: Position Overview:  The Front Desk Executive plays a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth functioning of client interactions and office operations at Sporting Ethos. This position requires exceptional interpersonal skills, organisational abilities, and a proactive approach to managing various responsibilities. Responsibilities: Appointment Management: Manage client appointments through proactive calling and messaging, minimising cancellations and last-minute changes. Develop effective strategies to maximize client footfall and optimize scheduling to ensure efficient use of time. 2. Client Relations: Greet clients warmly and ensure they feel comfortable and valued in the environment. Handle client inquiries and concerns with professionalism and empathy. De-escalate tensions related to client services and manage difficult situations effectively. 3. Internal Coordination: Collaborate with internal experts and clients to facilitate seamless communication and assistance. Coordinate with office management and housekeeping staff to ensure the smooth functioning and cleanliness of the facility. 4. Office Administration: Maintain an inventory of office supplies and oversee maintenance work to uphold the facility's standards. Implement and monitor safety and security protocols to ensure the well-being of staff and clients. Maintain proper records of billing and payments, as well as session details and client information. Keep a log of client birthdays and other relevant administrative bookkeeping tasks. 5. Process Improvement: Organize systems and processes at both individual and company levels to enhance efficiency and scalability. Contribute to the expansion of operations across multiple locations by establishing structured workflows and protocols. 6. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Hospitality, or a related field preferred. Postgraduate qualification highly desirable. Work experience in healthcare sector desirable. Proven experience in customer service, administrative support, or a similar role. Excellent communication, problem-solving, and organizational skills. Ability to remain calm and composed in high-pressure situations. Proficiency in MS Office suite, especially Excel, and Google Sheets. Strong command over English language, both written and verbal, preferred. Note:  This job description may evolve to meet the changing needs of the company. Candidates with postgraduate qualifications and strong English language skills will be given higher preference.

The ideal candidate should possess a pleasing personality, excellent communication skills, and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience. Key Responsibilities: Front Desk Management: Greet and welcome visitors in a professional and friendly manner. Manage and direct incoming calls and inquiries. Maintain a tidy and organized front office area. 2.    Administrative Support: Assist in handling day-to-day administrative tasks. Coordinate and schedule  appointments and meetings. Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence. 3.    Communication Skills: Effectively communicate with internal and external stakeholders. Respond promptly to emails and  inquiries. Draft and prepare official communication. 4.    Visitor Coordination: Ensure a positive experience for all visitors. Manage visitor log and security protocols. 5.    Documentation and Record Keeping: Maintain accurate records and files. Assist in preparing reports and presentations. 6.    Calendar Management: Manage executive calendars and schedules. Qualifications:   Minimum of 2 years of experience as an Admin/Front Office Executive. Bachelor's degree or equivalent. Pleasing personality with a professional demeanor. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize effectively. Immediate joiner preferred. Why us? Perks & Benefits: Immense opportunities for growth, personal development & career opportunities. We also champion a workplace culture that thrives on passion, collaboration, efficiency, and innovation. Dynamic Teamwork Environment, Fantastic flexibility Work life balance Medical Benefits   If this sounds like the role for you to drive your career to great heights, APPLY NOW!! We are interviewing candidates for an immediate start! Submit your resume today at   trishna@broadwayinfotech.com or call@ 9625261326

column2: We are looking for a pleasant Front Desk Representative to undertake all receptionist and clerical duties at the desk of our main entrance. column2: We are looking for a Front Office cum HR Executive to manage front office operations, HR functions, administrative tasks, and oversee training, sales, and operations activities. The ideal candidate will ensure smooth office functioning, handle incoming calls, greet visitors, schedule interviews, manage documentation, and maintain MIS. Duration: Key Responsibilities: 1. Front Office Operations Management: 1.1. Manage all front office operations, including answering incoming calls, welcoming visitors, and handling courier logistics. 1.2. Ensure a professional and efficient front desk experience for all guests and stakeholders. 2. HR Administration: 2.1. Oversee HR functions such as interview scheduling, document management, and facilitating new employee onboarding procedures. 2.2. Coordinate first-day joining formalities to ensure a smooth transition for new hires. 3. Meeting Coordination: 3.1. Coordinate and arrange meetings, ensuring all necessary logistics are in place for successful meetings. 4. Administrative Supervision: 4.1. Supervise various administrative tasks, including vendor bill verification, inventory management of stationary and housekeeping materials, monitoring office staff attendance, organizing festivities, and managing training and sales materials. 5. Training and Operations Oversight: 5.1. Supervise training activities, including Train The Trainer (TTT) programs and certification processes, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives. 5.2. Oversee operational functions to ensure smooth day-to-day operations of the center. 6. Sales Inquiry Management: 6.1. Handle sales inquiries and calls from potential customers and learners, providing relevant information and assistance as needed. 7. Office Maintenance: 7.1. Ensure the daily upkeep and maintenance of the office and center premises to create a conducive work environment. 8. Management Information System (MIS) Maintenance: 8.1. Maintain the Management Information System (MIS) to track and report key operational metrics and performance indicators accurately. Eligibility Criteria: 1. Graduation with at least 2 years of work experience. 2. Preferably from an education background; experience in banking, insurance, finance, or telecom is also acceptable. 3. Proficient in MS Office with a good understanding of Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. 4. Excellent communication and presentability skills. 5. Ability to maintain data accurately. 6. Fluency in English and Hindi. Additional Qualification: 1. Experience in managing front office operations and HR functions. 2. Knowledge of handling administrative tasks efficiently. 3. Familiarity with maintaining MIS. 4. Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment. 5. Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.

column2: A Front Desk Executive in the hotel industry is a professional who serves as the primary point of contact for guests and provides exceptional customer service at the front desk or reception area of a hotel     They play a crucial role in creating a positive first impression and ensuring a smooth guest experience         Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the role of a Front Desk Executive in the hotel industry         Guest check-in and check-out: The Front Desk Executive welcomes guests, registers them upon arrival, and handles the check-in and check-out processes efficiently     They verify guest information, collect payment, and provide room keys or access cards     Reservation management: They manage hotel reservations by assisting guests with booking inquiries, making new reservations, modifying existing reservations, and ensuring accuracy and availability of room inventory     Guest inquiries and assistance: The Front Desk Executive responds to guest inquiries, requests, and complaints promptly and professionally     They provide information about hotel facilities, amenities, services, local attractions, and assist with any special requests or arrangements     Cash handling and billing: They handle cash transactions, credit card payments, and ensure accurate billing and invoicing for guest services     The Front Desk Executive reconciles daily cash receipts, prepares shift reports, and follows cash handling procedures     Communication and coordination: They effectively communicate with other hotel departments, such as housekeeping, maintenance, and room service, to coordinate guest requests, room readiness, and any other guest-related matters     Guest safety and security: The Front Desk Executive maintains a vigilant approach to guest safety and security     They follow hotel security protocols, monitor CCTV systems, and address any security concerns or incidents promptly

column2: Job Summary: We are seeking a dynamic and personable Front Office cum Admin Executive to be the primary point of contact for our organization. This role entails managing the front desk, handling administrative tasks, and providing support to various departments. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a welcoming demeanor, and the ability to multitask efficiently. Key Responsibilities: Front Desk Management: Responsible for day-to-day receptionist duties, including welcoming and greeting guests, managing reservations, answering phone calls and emails, and handling customer service inquiries. Assist with visitor sign-in through Visitor Management System, issue visitor badges, and notify appropriate staff of guest arrivals. Office Management: Oversee day-to-day office operations, including maintaining office supplies, equipment, and facilities.  Coordinate and supervise administrative staff to ensure tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner.  Process invoices and purchase requests as per company policies.  Executive Support: Provide comprehensive administrative support to executives, including calendar management, meeting scheduling, and travel arrangements.  Schedule appointments and maintain calendars for executives.  Coordinate meeting room bookings and manage conference room schedules.  Travel Arrangements: Assist in making travel arrangements for employees, including booking flights, hotels, and transportation.  Event Coordination: Assist in the planning and coordination of company events and meetings.  Provide logistical support for events held on-site.  Record Keeping/ Data Management: Maintain and organize electronic and hard copy files, ensuring data accuracy and confidentiality.  Assist in the preparation of reports, spreadsheets, and other documentation as needed.  Qualifications:   Bachelors degree Minimum 3-5 years of proven experience in the front office and administrative role Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and basic office equipment.  Pleasant and professional behavior with strong customer service skills Additional Requirements: Ability to handle tasks with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.  Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.  Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.  Knowledge of office management systems and procedures.  If you have the necessary qualifications and are enthusiastic about contributing to a positive and organized workplace, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience for consideration. We look forward to welcoming a dedicated Front Office /Admin Executive to our team. Note: This position requires you to work in the office 5 days a week (Mon- Fri , 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM)
column11: Administrative Support, Receptionist Activities, Front Office Operations, Front Office Management, Admin Activities, General Office Management

column2: Greeting and Welcoming: The Front Office Associate is typically the first point of contact for visitors     They warmly greet and welcome guests, clients, or patients as they enter the establishment     Check-In and Check-Out: In a hotel or a similar setting, they handle guest check-ins and check-outs, facilitating the registration process and ensuring that guests have a smooth arrival and departure experience     Appointment Scheduling: In medical offices and similar settings, they schedule appointments for clients, patients, or customers, ensuring that appointments are coordinated efficiently     Answering Inquiries: Responding to inquiries and providing information to visitors about the establishment, services, or facilities     This may include answering questions about room availability, office hours, or appointment procedures     Phone Management: Answering and directing phone calls to the appropriate departments or individuals     They may also take messages and provide information over the phone     Mail and Package Handling: Receiving and distributing mail and packages, ensuring that they reach the intended recipients promptly     Security and Access Control: Monitoring the entrance area for security purposes, ensuring that only authorized individuals gain access     In some cases, they may issue visitor badges or access cards

column2: Nethradhama Superspeciality Eye Hospital is looking for Executive Front Desk to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As an Executive Front Desk professional -your role would involve managing the reception area and providing administrative support to executives and visitors      Here's an overview of the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the role:Reception and Guest Services: Greeting visitors, answering phone calls, and addressing inquiries or directing them to the appropriate personnel      As an Executive Front Desk professional, you would create a welcoming and professional environment, ensuring visitors receive a positive first impression of the company      Appointment and Meeting Management: Scheduling and coordinating appointments, meetings, and conference room bookings for executives      This includes managing calendars, sending meeting invites, and ensuring that meeting rooms are prepared with necessary equipment and materials      Travel and Logistics: Assisting executives with travel arrangements, including booking flights, accommodations, ground transportation, and other travel-related services      You would also handle travel itineraries, expense reports, and reimbursements as needed      Administrative Support: Providing general administrative support to executives, such as handling correspondence, managing emails, drafting documents, and maintaining files and records      You may also assist with data entry, report preparation, and other administrative tasks as required      Visitor Management: Monitoring and managing visitor access to the premises, including issuing visitor badges, coordinating with security personnel, and ensuring compliance with access control policies and procedures

column2: Office & Reception Management Company Profile Merilytics, an Accordion company, is a fast-growing analytics firm offering advanced analytics solutions to clients globally. We combine domain expertise, advanced analytics, and technology to provide robust solutions for clients business problems. You can find further details about the company at https://merilytics.com We partner with clients in industries such as Private Equity, CPG, Retail, Technology, Logistics, Healthcare etc. by providing analytical solutions to generate superior returns. We solve clients business problems by analyzing large amount of data to help guide their Operations, Marketing, Pricing, Customer Strategies, and much more. Position: The Office & Reception management position at Merilytics will require the person to carry out crucial responsibilities in fostering a professional and inviting environment for guests and employees, all while efficiently overseeing front desk operations. The responsibilities will encompass assisting smooth office functioning and delivering exceptional visitor experiences. The role also entails helping improve the efficiency of office functionalities and reducing facility management workload. The candidate must have excellent time-management skills, be a good multitasker and be assertive in their communication. Location:  Hyderabad, Telangana Key Responsibilities     Visitor Engagement:  Accountable for performing administrative tasks to ensure smooth operations, such as responding to emails, greeting guests courteously, scheduling appointments, organizing files, and maintaining office supplies. This will require schedule & calendar management with proficiency and structured planning.    Front Desk Management:  Responsible for attending all the incoming calls and forwarding calls to the appropriate person(s) or office for assistance. Ensure the reception area remains organized and presentable while managing office security by monitoring access and issuing visitor badges. Assist in office maintenance and ensure policy compliance and confidentiality protocols for smooth workflow.    Information management:  Provide accurate information in-person to guests and employees and also via phone/email to address external enquiries efficiently. Additionally receive and resolve feedback/queries in a manner consistent with company policies. Make management aware of any complaints real-time.    Administrative Support:  Handle mail and package distribution to ensure timely delivery, perform clerical receptionist duties such as filing (front desk information management), photocopying, and transcribing to support overall office efficiency. Work closely with facilities administration to ensure supplies, inventory and timely action initiated on any support required for front office management. Stay updated with Leadership calendar and provide timely updates to leaders for their required presence & inclusion.  Office events:  Assist with responsibilities from an administration aspect for office events, festivities, townhall setup (in office events) etc. This will also include assisting (in-office) for key responsibilities in ensuring all pre-requisites for the events in terms of arrangements, approvals, and necessary supplies / stock as required are in order.    Pre-requisites   and   skillsets   required   to   apply   for   this   role:   Proven experience as a receptionist or office management role, ideally with a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience. Undergraduate degree with strong performance; Hotel management/Masters degree and/or business degree is a plus Excellent verbal & written communication skills Excellent organizational, management and interpersonal skills Proficiency in basic computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook), and familiarity with office equipment such as printers and scanners Demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks, manage time efficiently, and maintain attention to detail in a dynamic office environment   Why Explore a Career at Merilytics: High growth environment:  Semi-annual performance management and promotion cycles coupled with a strong meritocratic culture, enables fast track to leadership responsibility. Entrepreneurial Environment : Intellectual freedom to make decisions and own them. We expect you to spread your wings and assume larger responsibilities. Fun culture and peer group:  Non-bureaucratic and fun working environment; Strong peer environment that will challenge you and accelerate your learning curve. Other benefits for full time employees:  Health and wellness programs that include employee health insurance covering immediate family members and parents, term life insurance for employees, free health camps for employees, discounted health services (including vision, dental) for employee and family members, free doctors consultations, counsellors, etc.  Corporate Meal card options for ease of use and tax benefits Work dinners, team lunches, company sponsored team outings and celebrations. Reimbursement for office commute as per company policy, applicable to all employees Cab reimbursement for women employees beyond a certain time of the day Robust leave policy to support work-life balance. Specially designed leave structure to support woman employees for maternity and related requests. Reward and recognition platform to celebrate professional and personal milestones. A positive & transparent work environment including various employee engagement and employee benefit initiatives to support personal and professional learning and development.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Serving on the front lines of customer service Are you a people person who can make daily interactions such a breeze? In this role, youll be in charge of one of the busiest places in the officethe front desk. Constantly on the go, you??l give our visitors a warm welcome, and guide them and our employees along the way. In other words, you will set the benchmark in giving our company a good first impression. Throughout the day, you will also handle all incoming and outgoing calls, including distribution. Therefore, it is essential to remain professional and polite in the way you present yourself, from appearance to behaviour. You will spend each day looking at how you can maintain and improve the front office. Part of your checklist is to get your hands on the latest magazines and newspapers to be displayed in the reception.  Being at the heart of the business Maintaining and updating records and database are also part of your basic daily routine. These include telephone registers, call tracking and client contacts. Much of your time will also be spent on general admin activities and other help desk tasks. Working at JLL, you should constantly keep in mind that you are working in compliance with our regulations. Other responsibilities you will take care of include contributing to the monthly management report for the client and participating in emergency evacuation procedures. On top of these, you??l be expected to develop policies and procedures needed for all functions in the reception. As needed, you??l also take part in managing conference rooms, events, flower arrangement coordination, and others. Sound like you? To apply you need to be: A highly skilled professional You should be a graduate in any discipline and have one to five years??experience in front desk management or reception. Proven experience with continuous improvement initiatives and client reporting is also vital for this role. If you??e familiar with occupational safety requirements matched with strong computer literacy and the ability to manage activities using different systems, then you might be the best fit for this job. A client service champ A strong customer service focus is a pre-requisite of this job. Do you have unmatched people skills that can help you ease your interactions with a wide range of client staff??egardless of their level??nd their demands? An outstanding multitasking talent also provides a perfect complement to your skill set. column2: Greeting and Welcoming: The Front Office Associate is typically the first point of contact for visitors. They warmly greet and welcome guests, clients, or patients as they enter the establishment.      Check-In and Check-Out: In a hotel or a similar setting, they handle guest check-ins and check-outs, facilitating the registration process and ensuring that guests have a smooth arrival and departure experience.      Appointment Scheduling: In medical offices and similar settings, they schedule appointments for clients, patients, or customers, ensuring that appointments are coordinated efficiently.      Answering Inquiries: Responding to inquiries and providing information to visitors about the establishment, services, or facilities. This may include answering questions about room availability, office hours, or appointment procedures.      Phone Management: Answering and directing phone calls to the appropriate departments or individuals. They may also take messages and provide information over the phone.      Mail and Package Handling: Receiving and distributing mail and packages, ensuring that they reach the intended recipients promptly.      Security and Access Control: Monitoring the entrance area for security purposes, ensuring that only authorized individuals gain access. In some cases, they may issue visitor badges or access cards.

column2: Job Responsibilities of Front Office Executive: Greeting Employees and Visitors: As the first point of contact for anyone entering the office premises, the Front Office Executive warmly welcomes employees, clients, and visitors. They create a positive and professional impression through their friendly demeanor and helpful attitude. Managing Registers and Records: The Front Office Executive is responsible for handling various registers, including visitor logs, attendance records, courier registers, and other essential documents. They ensure that all records are accurate, up-to-date, and well-organized. ID Cards, Business Cards, and Welcome Kits: Another key responsibility is managing the issuance of ID cards and business cards to employees. They also prepare welcome kits for new employees, which may include necessary office supplies and informational materials. Stationery Management: The Front Office Executive takes charge of monitoring and maintaining an adequate stock of stationery items. They ensure that office supplies like pens, notepads, envelopes, and other stationery essentials are available for employees as required. Reporting: Generating various reports is a vital aspect of the role. The Front Office Executive may be responsible for preparing daily attendance reports, visitor logs, and other reports as requested by management. Meeting and Board Room Setup: They play a crucial role in setting up meeting rooms and board rooms for client meetings, internal discussions, and other events. This includes arranging seating, audio-visual equipment, and any other necessary materials. Client Hospitality: Ensuring a pleasant experience for clients during their visit is a priority. The Front Office Executive may handle arranging refreshments, snacks, or meals, as well as attending to any special requests to enhance client hospitality. ISO Audit Compliance: As part of maintaining ISO standards, the Front Office Executive ensures proper documentation and adherence to audit-related requirements for the front desk operations. Effective Communication: They maintain clear and efficient communication channels between the front desk and other departments. Keeping the local administration informed of updates, schedules, and appointments is vital to ensure smooth operations. Professional Communication: Handling phone calls, emails, and inquiries with professionalism and courtesy is essential. The Front Office Executive ensures prompt and accurate responses to internal and external communication. General Administrative Support: Assisting with general administrative tasks, such as data entry, filing, and coordinating office events, is part of their duties. They may also provide support to other departments as needed. Continuous Improvement: To excel in their role, the Front Office Executive continuously seeks opportunities for improvement in customer service, administrative processes, and overall efficiency of front desk operations.

column2: As a Front-Desk Executive at GradXs Study Abroad, you would be responsible for managing the front desk operations and providing excellent customer service to clients, visitors, and staff. You will undertake following roles: Reception Duties: Greeting clients and visitors with a warm and welcoming demeanour, answering phone calls, and directing inquiries to the appropriate staff members or departments. Client Registration and Intake: Assisting clients with completing registration forms, collecting necessary documents, and entering client information into the consultancy's database accurately. Handling Inquiries and Requests: Addressing client inquiries, requests, and concerns promptly and professionally, and escalating complex issues to the appropriate staff members for resolution. Office Maintenance: Ensuring the reception area and waiting area are clean, organized, and stocked with necessary supplies such as brochures, application forms, and promotional materials. Administrative Support: Assisting with administrative tasks as per requirement. Visitor Management: Registering and issuing visitor badges to guests, informing staff members of visitor arrivals, and ensuring that visitors adhere to security protocols while on-site. Handling Payments: Collecting fees, processing payments, issuing receipts, and maintaining accurate records of financial transactions in accordance with company policies and procedures. Customer Relationship Management: Building and maintaining positive relationships with clients and visitors, ensuring their needs are met efficiently, and providing assistance and support to enhance their experience with the consultancy. Professionalism and Etiquette: Demonstrating professionalism, confidentiality, and discretion in handling sensitive information and interactions with clients and colleagues. Multi-tasking and Time Management: Managing multiple tasks simultaneously, prioritizing effectively, and ensuring that all front desk responsibilities are handled in a timely manner. column2: Job Description:  A  Receptionist cum EA  is a professional who manages the front desk of an organization while also assisting with admin tasks. They are usually the first point of contact for customers and visitors. Here are the key responsibilities and duties for this role:   Greeting and Welcoming: Receive visitors at the front desk by greeting, welcoming, directing, and announcing them appropriately. Maintain a friendly and professional demeanor. Phone Handling: Answer, screen, and forward incoming phone calls. Ensure prompt and courteous communication. Office Coordination: Direct visitors to the appropriate person and office. Coordinate front-desk activities, including distributing correspondence and redirecting phone calls. Administrative Support: Keep the reception area tidy and presentable, with all necessary stationery and materials. Provide basic and accurate information in-person and via phone/email. Receive, sort, and distribute daily mail and deliveries. Security and Inventory: Maintain office security by following safety procedures and controlling access via the reception desk (monitor logbook, issue visitor badges). Order front office supplies and keep inventory of stock. Additional Tasks: Update calendars and schedule meetings. Arrange travel and accommodations, and prepare vouchers. Keep updated records of office expenses and costs. Perform other clerical receptionist duties such as filing, photocopying, transcribing.

column2: Railtech Infraventutres Pvt. Ltd.  is looking for Receptionist  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A receptionist plays a crucial role in managing the front desk and providing administrative support in various organizations     Their primary responsibility is to create a positive and welcoming atmosphere for visitors, clients, and employees     The specific job description of a receptionist can vary depending on the industry and organization, but here are some common responsibilities and skills associated with the role:Welcoming and Greeting:      Receptionists are the first point of contact for visitors and clients     They greet guests, provide them with necessary information, and direct them to the appropriate person or department     They ensure a friendly and professional demeanor to create a positive impression     Answering and Managing Phone Calls: Receptionists handle incoming calls, screen and forward them to the relevant individuals or departments     They provide information, take messages, and handle inquiries effectively     Strong communication skills and a polite telephone manner are important for this aspect of the role     Managing Front Desk Operations: Receptionists manage the front desk area, ensuring it is clean, organized, and well-presented     They may also handle tasks such as scheduling appointments, managing calendars, and maintaining office supplies     Handling Correspondence: Receptionists often handle incoming and outgoing mail, packages, and deliveries     They distribute mail to the appropriate recipients and ensure timely and accurate handling of documents     Customer Service: Receptionists provide excellent customer service by addressing inquiries, resolving complaints, and assisting visitors or clients with their needs     They maintain a helpful and professional attitude and handle challenging situations with patience and tact     Administrative Support: Receptionists may be responsible for various administrative tasks, including data entry, filing, typing, and maintaining records     They may also assist with basic bookkeeping tasks or support other departments with administrative duties as needed     Multitasking and Organization: Receptionists need to effectively manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize their workload     They should have strong organizational skills to maintain an efficient and smoothly running front desk     Technology Proficiency: Receptionists often work with various office equipment and computer systems     Proficiency in using email, scheduling software, word processing applications, and other relevant tools is important for the role     Overall, a successful receptionist should have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, be well-organized, and be able to handle a range of administrative tasks efficiently     They should maintain a professional and courteous demeanor while representing the organization to visitors and clients

column2: Position Title: Front Office Executive   Location: Vankas Job Summary:  The Front Office Executive plays a crucial role in ensuring smooth operations at the front desk of our manufacturing company. This position involves greeting visitors, answering inquiries, and providing information to the visitors. Additionally, the Front Office Executive is responsible for overseeing housekeeping duties and maintaining the appearance of the company's premises through gardening activities.  Key Responsibilities: Welcoming Visitors:  Greet visitors in a      professional and friendly manner and direct them to the appropriate person      or department. Telephone Management:  Answer incoming calls,      determine the purpose of callers, and transfer calls to appropriate      personnel or departments. Take and deliver messages accurately and in a      timely manner. Office Administration & Record Keeping:       Perform general administrative tasks, including managing and maintaining      files, records, and documents. Coordinate office activities and operations      to ensure efficiency and compliance with company policies. Courier and Email Handling:  Sort and      distribute incoming couriers and prepare outgoing couriers for dispatch.      Manage and respond to emails in a professional and timely manner. Visitor Management:  Maintain a log of      visitors and ensure compliance with security procedures. Monitor Issuing      visitor badges and ensure visitors are escorted as required. Housekeeping:  Oversee housekeeping duties to      maintain cleanliness and tidiness in office spaces, including reception areas      and common areas. Coordinate with housekeeping staff to ensure timely      cleaning and sanitation. Gardening:  Maintain the appearance of      outdoor areas, including lawns, gardens, and landscaping features. Oversee      gardening tasks such as mowing lawns, trimming hedges, watering plants,      and removing weeds. Ensure that outdoor areas are always well-maintained      and presentable. Supply Management:  Monitor and maintain      office supplies inventory. Place orders for office supplies as needed. Admin Support in Events:  Provide      administrative support to the events management team and Assist with      logistical arrangements such as venue booking, props arrangements,      catering, transportation, and equipment rentals. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or      related field preferred. Proven experience in a similar role, preferably in      a manufacturing or industrial setting. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel,      Outlook). Ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion. Professional appearance and demeanour.

column2: Front Office / Reception:Greeting Visitors: Welcoming and assisting visitors, clients, and guests as they arrive at the office or facility     Phone Management: Handling incoming and outgoing calls, taking messages, and transferring calls to the appropriate individuals or departments     Appointment Scheduling: Managing appointments, meetings, and reservations, and coordinating them with staff members     Mail and Package Handling: Sorting and distributing incoming mail and packages, as well as coordinating outgoing shipments     Reception Area Maintenance: Ensuring the reception area is clean, organized, and well-maintained     Visitor Badges: Issuing visitor badges, maintaining visitor logs, and ensuring the security and safety of the premises     Information and Assistance: Providing general information, directions, and assistance to visitors and employees     Notification: Notifying staff of visitor arrivals, deliveries, or appointments     Admin Support: Providing basic administrative support, such as data entry, document scanning, and photocopying     Secretarial / Administrative:Calendar Management: Managing and coordinating appointments, meetings, and deadlines for executives and staff     Email and Correspondence: Handling email communication, drafting and proofreading correspondence, and managing documents     File Management: Organizing and column2: The Front Office Manager (FOM) is a key position in the hospitality industry, responsible for overseeing the operations of the front office department in hotels, resorts, and other accommodation establishments      The FOM plays a crucial role in ensuring smooth and efficient guest experiences and maintaining high standards of customer service        While specific job descriptions may vary depending on the organization, here is a general overview of the key responsibilities and qualifications for a Front Office Manager:      Responsibilities:        Guest Services: Ensure excellent guest service and satisfaction by training and supervising front office staff, setting service standards, and resolving guest issues or complaints      Operations Management: Oversee the daily operations of the front office department, including managing room reservations, guest check-in and check-out processes, and handling cash transactions      Staff Management: Recruit, train, schedule, and supervise front office staff, including front desk agents, concierge, bell staff, and other relevant positions      Financial Management: Monitor and control front office expenses, maintain accurate financial records, prepare budgets, and implement cost-saving measures      Technology and Systems: Ensure the effective use of front office systems and technologies, including property management systems (PMS), reservation systems, and other relevant software      Coordination: Collaborate with other departments, such as housekeeping, maintenance, and sales, to ensure effective communication and coordination of guest-related activities      Reporting and Analysis: Prepare reports on front office performance, occupancy rates, guest satisfaction, and other relevant metrics, and use data analysis to identify areas for improvement      Training and Development: Conduct regular training sessions for front office staff to enhance their skills, product knowledge, and customer service abilities
column11: Front office, Hotel management

column2: An office coordinator oversees the office environment, manages office tasks and communications, and assists upper management with key functions. A typical day might involve handling incoming and outgoing emails, phone calls, and mail, as well as scheduling meetings, travel, and appointments. and coordinating meetings. Office coordinators help implement office procedures to improve efficiency and flow. They manage office files and records and ensure everyday office and clerical tasks are completed in a timely manner.     An office coordinator has high-level communication and organizational skills. They must be comfortable dealing with customers, clients, and vendors on the phone and in person. They keep track of office expenses, perform basic bookkeeping functions, and handle customer issues. A good understanding of basic accounting principles and office management systems and procedures is required. Office coordinators should be familiar with MS Office and accounting software and should be able to work with typical office equipment. Good organizational skills and the ability to multitask are important.

column2: 1.a. Welcome visitors during visiting hours, manage visitors who come outside visiting hours      b. Lead tours through the hospital and shelter      c. Coordinate visits and tours within and outside visiting hours      2. Volunteers: a. Manage communication and bookings via email with prospective volunteers b. Orient volunteers on their first day and provide the necessary training and explanation c. Prepare the daily schedule of the volunteers, making sure they get experience with different      animals and tasks to deepen their understanding and relationship with cows, donkeys, goats and sheep as well as dogs and cats      d. Supervise the volunteers and ensure all guidelines are followed and that volunteers or visitors not following guidelines are promptly explained      3. Animal care: a. Keep current with the animals in the hospital and their special needs, so that those who need the      b. Report immediately any animal who shows signs of illness or distress to the Animal Welfare Manager      a. Events: participate in outreach events, at the centre or external (schools, community meetings etc), to promote the respect of animal welfare and work of Animal Aid, encouraging the community to take an active role; to educate the community about animal behaviour, dog-bite prevention and coexistence.      b. Adoption: identify the animals who can be adopted, screen potential adopters, implement adoption protocols.      Experience, education and skills 1. Fluency in English, fluency in Hindi is a big plus but not required 2. Good IT skills (Microsoft office, Google tools) 3. Previous volunteering experience is plus      Personal attributes 1. Understanding and passion for Animal Aid s mission 2. Warm and welcoming personality, able to be clear and direct 3. Good communication and organizational skills 4. People oriented and able to connect with people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences 5. Compassionate and comfortable with animals
